GPL-3.0\npragma solidity ^0.8.22;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20Burnable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/IERC20Metadata.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/AccessControl.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/ReentrancyGuard.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/structs/EnumerableSet.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title MultiCollateralToken (MCT)\n * @notice Multi-collateral token that can accept various assets and mint MCT tokens\n * @dev This token serves as the underlying asset for nUSD OVault\n */\ncontract MultiCollateralToken is ERC20, ERC20Burnable, AccessControl, ReentrancyGuard {\n    using SafeERC20 for IERC20;\n    using EnumerableSet for EnumerableSet.AddressSet;\n\n    /* --------------- CONSTANTS --------------- */\n\n    /// @notice Role for managing collateral\n    bytes32 public constant COLLATERAL_MANAGER_ROLE = keccak256(\"COLLATERAL_MANAGER_ROLE\");\n\n    /// @notice Role for minting MCT\n    bytes32 public constant MINTER_ROLE = keccak256(\"MINTER_ROLE\");\n\n    /* --------------- STATE VARIABLES --------------- */\n\n    /// @notice Supported collateral assets\n    EnumerableSet.AddressSet private _supportedAssets;\n\n    /// @notice Total collateral value tracked per asset\n    mapping(address => uint256) public collateralBalance;\n\n    /* --------------- EVENTS --------------- */\n\n    event AssetAdded(address indexed asset);\n    event AssetRemoved(address indexed asset);\n    event Minted(\n        address indexed beneficiary,\n        address indexed collateralAsset,\n        uint256 collateralAmount,\n        uint256 mctAmount\n    );\n    event Redeemed(\n        address indexed beneficiary,\n        address indexed collateralAsset,\n        uint256 mctAmount,\n        uint256 collateralAmount\n    );\n    event CollateralWithdrawn(address indexed asset, uint256 amount, address indexed to);\n    event UnbackedMint(address indexed beneficiary, uint256 mctAmount);\n\n    /* --------------- ERRORS --------------- */\n\n    error ZeroAddressException();\n    error InvalidAmount();\n    error UnsupportedAsset();\n    error InvalidAssetAddress();\n    error InsufficientCollateral();\n\n    /* --------------- CONSTRUCTOR --------------- */\n\n    constructor(address admin, address[] memory initialAssets) ERC20(\"MultiCollateralToken\", \"MCT\") {\n        if (admin == address(0)) revert ZeroAddressException();\n\n        _grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, admin);\n        _grantRole(COLLATERAL_MANAGER_ROLE, admin);\n\n        // Add initial supported assets\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < initialAssets.length; i++) {\n            _addSupportedAsset(initialAssets[i]);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /* --------------- EXTERNAL --------------- */\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Mint MCT by depositing collateral\n     * @param collateralAsset The asset to deposit as collateral\n     * @param collateralAmount The amount of collateral to deposit\n     * @param beneficiary The address to receive minted MCT\n     * @return mctAmount The amount of MCT minted\n     */\n    function mint(\n        address collateralAsset,\n        uint256 collateralAmount,\n        address beneficiary\n    ) external nonReentrant onlyRole(MINTER_ROLE) returns (uint256 mctAmount) {\n        if (collateralAmount == 0) revert InvalidAmount();\n        if (!_supportedAssets.contains(collateralAsset)) revert UnsupportedAsset();\n        if (beneficiary == address(0)) revert ZeroAddressException();\n\n        // Convert collateral to MCT amount (normalize decimals to 18)\n        mctAmount = _convertToMCTAmount(collateralAsset, collateralAmount);\n\n        // Transfer collateral from caller to this contract\n        IERC20(collateralAsset).safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), collateralAmount);\n\n        // Update collateral balance\n        collateralBalance[collateralAsset] += collateralAmount;\n\n        // Mint MCT to beneficiary\n        _mint(beneficiary, mctAmount);\n\n        emit Minted(beneficiary, collateralAsset, collateralAmount, mctAmount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Mint MCT without depositing collateral (admin-controlled)\n     * @param beneficiary The address to receive minted MCT\n     * @param mctAmount The amount of MCT to mint\n     */\n    function mintWithoutCollateral(address beneficiary, uint256 mctAmount) external onlyRole(MINTER_ROLE) {\n        if (mctAmount == 0) revert InvalidAmount();\n        if (beneficiary == address(0)) revert ZeroAddressException();\n\n        _mint(beneficiary, mctAmount);\n        emit UnbackedMint(beneficiary, mctAmount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Redeem MCT for collateral\n     * @param collateralAsset The asset to receive\n     * @param mctAmount The amount of MCT to burn\n     * @param beneficiary The address to receive collateral\n     * @return collateralAmount The amount of collateral returned\n     */\n    function redeem(\n        address collateralAsset,\n        uint256 mctAmount,\n        address beneficiary\n    ) external nonReentrant onlyRole(MINTER_ROLE) returns (uint256 collateralAmount) {\n        if (mctAmount == 0) revert InvalidAmount();\n        if (!_supportedAssets.contains(collateralAsset)) revert UnsupportedAsset();\n        if (beneficiary == address(0)) revert ZeroAddressException();\n\n        // Convert MCT amount to collateral amount\n        collateralAmount = _convertToCollateralAmount(collateralAsset, mctAmount);\n\n        // Check if sufficient collateral is available\n        if (collateralBalance[collateralAsset] < collateralAmount) {\n            revert InsufficientCollateral();\n        }\n\n        // Burn MCT from caller\n        _burn(msg.sender, mctAmount);\n\n        // Update collateral balance\n        collateralBalance[collateralAsset] -= collateralAmount;\n\n        // Transfer collateral to beneficiary\n        IERC20(collateralAsset).safeTransfer(beneficiary, collateralAmount);\n\n        emit Redeemed(beneficiary, collateralAsset, mctAmount, collateralAmount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Withdraw collateral for team management\n     * @param asset The asset to withdraw\n     * @param amount The amount to withdraw\n     * @param to The address to send the collateral to\n     */\n    function withdrawCollateral(\n        address asset,\n        uint256 amount,\n        address to\n    ) external nonReentrant onlyRole(COLLATERAL_MANAGER_ROLE) {\n        if (amount == 0) revert InvalidAmount();\n        if (!_supportedAssets.contains(asset)) revert UnsupportedAsset();\n        if (to == address(0)) revert ZeroAddressException();\n        if (collateralBalance[asset] < amount) revert InsufficientCollateral();\n\n        collateralBalance[asset] -= amount;\n        IERC20(asset).safeTransfer(to, amount);\n\n        emit CollateralWithdrawn(asset, amount, to);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Deposit collateral back from team management\n     * @param asset The asset to deposit\n     * @param amount The amount to deposit\n     */\n    function depositCollateral(address asset, uint256 amount) external nonReentrant onlyRole(COLLATERAL_MANAGER_ROLE) {\n        if (amount == 0) revert InvalidAmount();\n        if (!_supportedAssets.contains(asset)) revert UnsupportedAsset();\n\n        IERC20(asset).safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), amount);\n        collateralBalance[asset] += amount;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Add a new supported asset\n     * @param asset The asset address to add\n     */\n    function addSupportedAsset(address asset) external onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        _addSupportedAsset(asset);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Remove a supported asset\n     * @param asset The asset address to remove\n     */\n    function removeSupportedAsset(address asset) external onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        if (!_supportedAssets.remove(asset)) revert InvalidAssetAddress();\n        emit AssetRemoved(asset);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Check if an asset is supported\n     * @param asset The asset address to check\n     * @return bool True if asset is supported\n     */\n    function isSupportedAsset(address asset) external view returns (bool) {\n        return _supportedAssets.contains(asset);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Get all supported assets\n     * @return address[] Array of supported asset addresses\n     */\n    function getSupportedAssets() external view returns (address[] memory) {\n        uint256 length = _supportedAssets.length();\n        address[] memory assets = new address[](length);\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < length; i++) {\n            assets[i] = _supportedAssets.at(i);\n        }\n        return assets;\n    }\n\n    /* --------------- INTERNAL --------------- */\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Convert collateral amount to MCT amount (normalize decimals to 18)\n     * @param collateralAsset The collateral asset address\n     * @param collateralAmount The amount of collateral\n     * @return The equivalent MCT amount (18 decimals)\n     */\n    function _convertToMCTAmount(address collateralAsset, uint256 collateralAmount) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        uint8 collateralDecimals = IERC20Metadata(collateralAsset).decimals();\n\n        if (collateralDecimals == 18) {\n            return collateralAmount;\n        } else if (collateralDecimals < 18) {\n            // Scale up (e.g., USDC 6 decimals -> 18 decimals)\n            return collateralAmount * (10 ** (18 - collateralDecimals));\n        } else {\n            // Scale down (shouldn't happen with standard stablecoins)\n            return collateralAmount / (10 ** (collateralDecimals - 18));\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Convert MCT amount to collateral amount (denormalize decimals)\n     * @param collateralAsset The collateral asset address\n     * @param mctAmount The amount of MCT (18 decimals)\n     * @return The equivalent collateral amount\n     */\n    function _convertToCollateralAmount(address collateralAsset, uint256 mctAmount) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        uint8 collateralDecimals = IERC20Metadata(collateralAsset).decimals();\n\n        if (collateralDecimals == 18) {\n            return mctAmount;\n        } else if (collateralDecimals < 18) {\n            // Scale down (e.g., 18 decimals -> USDC 6 decimals)\n            return mctAmount / (10 ** (18 - collateralDecimals));\n        } else {\n            // Scale up (shouldn't happen with standard stablecoins)\n            return mctAmount * (10 ** (collateralDecimals - 18));\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Internal function to add supported asset\n     * @param asset The asset address to add\n     */\n    function _addSupportedAsset(address asset) internal {\n        if (asset == address(0) || asset == address(this)) {\n            revert InvalidAssetAddress();\n        }\n        if (!_supportedAssets.add(asset)) {\n            revert InvalidAssetAddress();\n        }\n        emit AssetAdded(asset);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x8c013417c088684971cebbc8556ed6f0a75f2f94591a1a49bd6ab8c5a0ffef91","license":"GPL-3.0"}},"version":1}

devdoc.details: This token serves as the underlying asset for nUSD OVault

AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

ERC20InsufficientAllowance(address,uint2.details: Indicates a failure with the `spender`s `allowance`. Used in transfers.

params.allowance: Amount of tokens a `spender` is allowed to operate with.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC20InsufficientBalance(address,uint256.details: Indicates an error related to the current `balance` of a `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.balance: Current balance for the interacting account.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidApprover(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.

ERC20InvalidReceiver(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.

params.receiver: Address to which tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSpender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `spender` to be approved. Used in approvals.

params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC-20 token failed.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the value of tokens owned by `account`.

burn(uint256).details: Destroys a `value` amount of tokens from the caller. See {ERC20-_burn}.

burnFrom(address,uint256).details: Destroys a `value` amount of tokens from `account`, deducting from the caller's allowance. See {ERC20-_burn} and {ERC20-allowance}. Requirements: - the caller must have allowance for ``accounts``'s tokens of at least `value`.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

returns._0: address[] Array of supported asset addresses

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns._0: bool True if asset is supported

params.beneficiary: The address to receive minted MCT
params.collateralAmount: The amount of collateral to deposit
params.collateralAsset: The asset to deposit as collateral

params.beneficiary: The address to receive minted MCT
params.mctAmount: The amount of MCT to mint

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

params.mctAmount: The amount of MCT to burn

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalSupply().details: Returns the value of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Skips emitting an {Approval} event indicating an allowance update. This is not required by the ERC. See {xref-ERC20-_approve-address-address-uint256-bool-}[_approve]. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

params.to: The address to send the collateral to
